diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,129 @@
+name: Regenerate Sitemap
+
+on:
+  schedule:
+    # Run weekly on Sunday at 2 AM UTC
+    - cron: '0 2 * * 0'
+  workflow_dispatch:
+    inputs:
+      reason:
+        description: 'Reason for regeneration'
+        required: false
+        default: 'Manual trigger'
+
+permissions:
+  id-token: write
+  contents: read
+
+env:
+  AWS_REGION: eu-west-1
+  ECR_REPOSITORY: portfolio/${{ github.event.repository.name }}
+  APP_RUNNER_SERVICE: portfolio-prod-${{ github.event.repository.name }}
+
+jobs:
+  regenerate:
+    name: Regenerate Sitemap and Redeploy
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout code
+        uses: actions/checkout@v6
+
+      - name: Configure AWS credentials (OIDC)
+        uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v5
+        with:
+          role-to-assume: ${{ secrets.AWS_ROLE_ARN }}
+          aws-region: ${{ env.AWS_REGION }}
+
+      - name: Login to Amazon ECR
+        id: login-ecr
+        uses: aws-actions/amazon-ecr-login@v2
+
+      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
+        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
+
+      - name: Generate version tag
+        id: version
+        run: |
+          echo "version=sitemap-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
+
+      - name: Build Docker image (includes sitemap generation)
+        env:
+          ECR_REGISTRY: ${{ steps.login-ecr.outputs.registry }}
+          IMAGE_TAG: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
+        run: |
+          docker build \
+            --build-arg VITE_API_URL=${{ secrets.VITE_API_URL }} \
+            --build-arg VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL=${{ secrets.VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL }} \
+            -t $ECR_REGISTRY/$ECR_REPOSITORY:$IMAGE_TAG \
+            .
body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü† Major_

**Build arguments expose secrets in Docker layer history.**

Passing secrets via `--build-arg` embeds them in the image layers, making them visible via `docker history`. For a public-facing website, consider using Docker BuildKit secrets or multi-stage builds where secrets are only used in discarded stages.


<details>
<summary>üîí Recommended approach using BuildKit secrets</summary>

```diff
      - name: Build Docker image (includes sitemap generation)
        env:
          ECR_REGISTRY: ${{ steps.login-ecr.outputs.registry }}
          IMAGE_TAG: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
+         DOCKER_BUILDKIT: 1
        run: |
          docker build \
-           --build-arg VITE_API_URL=${{ secrets.VITE_API_URL }} \
-           --build-arg VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL=${{ secrets.VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL }} \
+           --secret id=vite_api_url,env=VITE_API_URL \
+           --secret id=vite_message_api_url,env=VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL \
            -t $ECR_REGISTRY/$ECR_REPOSITORY:$IMAGE_TAG \
            .
+       env:
+         VITE_API_URL: ${{ secrets.VITE_API_URL }}
+         VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL: ${{ secrets.VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL }}
```

This requires updating the Dockerfile to use `RUN --mount=type=secret` syntax.
</details>

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In @.github/workflows/sitemap.yml around lines 54 - 59, The workflow currently
passes secrets via --build-arg (VITE_API_URL and VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL) to the
docker build command which embeds them into image layers; change the build to
avoid --build-arg for secrets by switching to BuildKit secrets or a multi-stage
build where secrets are used only in a discarded stage: update the workflow to
enable BuildKit and pass secrets via the secret mount mechanism (instead of
--build-arg) and update the Dockerfile to consume them with RUN
--mount=type=secret, or alternatively create a temporary build stage that uses
the secrets and is not present in the final image; ensure the docker build
invocation and the Dockerfile references (VITE_API_URL / VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL
usage) are adjusted accordingly so secrets are never baked into final layers.
```

</details>

<!-- fingerprinting:phantom:poseidon:ocelot -->

@@ -0,0 +1,129 @@
+name: Regenerate Sitemap
+
+on:
+  schedule:
+    # Run weekly on Sunday at 2 AM UTC
+    - cron: '0 2 * * 0'
+  workflow_dispatch:
+    inputs:
+      reason:
+        description: 'Reason for regeneration'
+        required: false
+        default: 'Manual trigger'
+
+permissions:
+  id-token: write
+  contents: read
+
+env:
+  AWS_REGION: eu-west-1
+  ECR_REPOSITORY: portfolio/${{ github.event.repository.name }}
+  APP_RUNNER_SERVICE: portfolio-prod-${{ github.event.repository.name }}
+
+jobs:
+  regenerate:
+    name: Regenerate Sitemap and Redeploy
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout code
+        uses: actions/checkout@v6
+
+      - name: Configure AWS credentials (OIDC)
+        uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v5
+        with:
+          role-to-assume: ${{ secrets.AWS_ROLE_ARN }}
+          aws-region: ${{ env.AWS_REGION }}
+
+      - name: Login to Amazon ECR
+        id: login-ecr
+        uses: aws-actions/amazon-ecr-login@v2
+
+      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
+        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
+
+      - name: Generate version tag
+        id: version
+        run: |
+          echo "version=sitemap-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
+
+      - name: Build Docker image (includes sitemap generation)
+        env:
+          ECR_REGISTRY: ${{ steps.login-ecr.outputs.registry }}
+          IMAGE_TAG: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
+        run: |
+          docker build \
+            --build-arg VITE_API_URL=${{ secrets.VITE_API_URL }} \
+            --build-arg VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL=${{ secrets.VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL }} \
+            -t $ECR_REGISTRY/$ECR_REPOSITORY:$IMAGE_TAG \
+            .
+
+      - name: Push Docker image to ECR
+        env:
+          ECR_REGISTRY: ${{ steps.login-ecr.outputs.registry }}
+          IMAGE_TAG: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
+        run: |
+          docker push $ECR_REGISTRY/$ECR_REPOSITORY:$IMAGE_TAG
+
+      - name: Get Service ARN
+        id: service-arn
+        run: |
+          SERVICE_ARN=$(aws apprunner list-services \
+            --region ${{ env.AWS_REGION }} \
+            --query "ServiceSummaryList[?ServiceName=='$APP_RUNNER_SERVICE'].ServiceArn" \
+            --output text)
+
+          if [ -z "$SERVICE_ARN" ]; then
+            echo "Service not found: $APP_RUNNER_SERVICE"
+            exit 1
+          fi
+
+          echo "arn=$SERVICE_ARN" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
+
+      - name: Update App Runner service
+        env:
+          ECR_REGISTRY: ${{ steps.login-ecr.outputs.registry }}
+          IMAGE_TAG: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
+        run: |
+          CURRENT_CONFIG=$(aws apprunner describe-service \
+            --region ${{ env.AWS_REGION }} \
+            --service-arn ${{ steps.service-arn.outputs.arn }} \
+            --query 'Service.SourceConfiguration' \
+            --output json)
+
+          IMAGE_URI="$ECR_REGISTRY/$ECR_REPOSITORY:$IMAGE_TAG"
+          UPDATED_CONFIG=$(echo "$CURRENT_CONFIG" | jq \
+            --arg image "$IMAGE_URI" \
+            '.ImageRepository.ImageIdentifier = $image')
+
+          aws apprunner update-service \
+            --region ${{ env.AWS_REGION }} \
+            --service-arn ${{ steps.service-arn.outputs.arn }} \
+            --source-configuration "$UPDATED_CONFIG"
+          echo "Sitemap regeneration deployed with tag $IMAGE_TAG"
+
+      - name: Wait for deployment
+        run: |
+          echo "Waiting for deployment..."
+          SERVICE_ARN="${{ steps.service-arn.outputs.arn }}"
+          MAX_ATTEMPTS=60
+          ATTEMPT=0
+          while [ $ATTEMPT -lt $MAX_ATTEMPTS ]; do
+            STATUS=$(aws apprunner describe-service \
+              --region ${{ env.AWS_REGION }} \
+              --service-arn "$SERVICE_ARN" \
+              --query 'Service.Status' \
+              --output text)
+            echo "Attempt $((ATTEMPT + 1))/$MAX_ATTEMPTS: Status = $STATUS"
+            if [ "$STATUS" = "RUNNING" ]; then
+              echo "Deployment completed"
+              exit 0
+            elif [ "$STATUS" = "CREATE_FAILED" ] || [ "$STATUS" = "DELETE_FAILED" ] || [ "$STATUS" = "UPDATE_FAILED" ]; then
+              echo "Deployment failed: $STATUS"
+              exit 1
+            fi
+            ATTEMPT=$((ATTEMPT + 1))
+            sleep 10
+          done
+          echo "Timeout"
+          exit 1
body:
_üßπ Nitpick_ | _üîµ Trivial_

**Consider including final status in timeout message for easier debugging.**

When the workflow times out, knowing the last observed status helps diagnose whether the deployment was stuck or progressing slowly.


<details>
<summary>‚ôªÔ∏è Enhanced timeout messaging</summary>

```diff
            sleep 10
          done
-         echo "Timeout"
+         echo "Timeout after $MAX_ATTEMPTS attempts. Last status: $STATUS"
          exit 1
```
</details>

<!-- suggestion_start -->

<summary>üìù Committable suggestion</summary>

```suggestion
      - name: Wait for deployment
        run: |
          echo "Waiting for deployment..."
          SERVICE_ARN="${{ steps.service-arn.outputs.arn }}"
          MAX_ATTEMPTS=60
          ATTEMPT=0
          while [ $ATTEMPT -lt $MAX_ATTEMPTS ]; do
            STATUS=$(aws apprunner describe-service \
              --region ${{ env.AWS_REGION }} \
              --service-arn "$SERVICE_ARN" \
              --query 'Service.Status' \
              --output text)
            echo "Attempt $((ATTEMPT + 1))/$MAX_ATTEMPTS: Status = $STATUS"
            if [ "$STATUS" = "RUNNING" ]; then
              echo "Deployment completed"
              exit 0
            elif [ "$STATUS" = "CREATE_FAILED" ] || [ "$STATUS" = "DELETE_FAILED" ] || [ "$STATUS" = "UPDATE_FAILED" ]; then
              echo "Deployment failed: $STATUS"
              exit 1
            fi
            ATTEMPT=$((ATTEMPT + 1))
            sleep 10
          done
          echo "Timeout after $MAX_ATTEMPTS attempts. Last status: $STATUS"
          exit 1
```

</details>

<!-- suggestion_end -->

<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In @.github/workflows/sitemap.yml around lines 105 - 129, The timeout branch
```

**Add tracking parameter for audit logging consistency.**

For consistency with other views (`MiniatureProject.vue`, `ProjectDetail.vue`), the image URL should be wrapped with `addSourceToFileUrl` in the SEO metadata. This ensures audit logging of image access across all similar view implementations.

Currently, `MiniatureProject.vue` (line 181) and `ProjectDetail.vue` (line 174) both use `addSourceToFileUrl` for og:image, but this view does not.

<details>
<summary>üîß Suggested fix</summary>

First, add the import:

```diff
 import { useSeoMeta } from '../composables/useSeoMeta'
+import { addSourceToFileUrl } from '../utils/fileUrl'
```

Then update the image computed:

```diff
 useSeoMeta({
```

_üßπ Nitpick_ | _üîµ Trivial_

**Consider adding a job-level timeout for resilience.**

The workflow relies on the wait loop's `MAX_ATTEMPTS` (60 iterations √ó 10s = ~10 minutes), but if any earlier step hangs (e.g., Docker build, ECR push), the job could run indefinitely. Adding a `timeout-minutes` at the job level provides a hard ceiling.

<details>
<summary>‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested improvement</summary>

```diff
 jobs:
   regenerate:
     name: Regenerate Sitemap and Redeploy
     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    timeout-minutes: 30
```
</details>

+name: Regenerate Sitemap
+
+on:
+  schedule:
+    # Run weekly on Sunday at 2 AM UTC
+    - cron: '0 2 * * 0'
+  workflow_dispatch:
+    inputs:
+      reason:
+        description: 'Reason for regeneration'
+        required: false
+        default: 'Manual trigger'
+
+permissions:
+  id-token: write
+  contents: read
+

+
+jobs:
+  regenerate:
+    name: Regenerate Sitemap and Redeploy
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout code
+        uses: actions/checkout@v6
+
+      - name: Configure AWS credentials (OIDC)
+        uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v5
+        with:
+          role-to-assume: ${{ secrets.AWS_ROLE_ARN }}
+          aws-region: ${{ env.AWS_REGION }}
+
+      - name: Login to Amazon ECR
+        id: login-ecr
+        uses: aws-actions/amazon-ecr-login@v2
+
+      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
+        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
+
+      - name: Generate version tag
+        id: version
+        run: |
+          echo "version=sitemap-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
+
+      - name: Build Docker image (includes sitemap generation)
+        env:
+          ECR_REGISTRY: ${{ steps.login-ecr.outputs.registry }}
+          IMAGE_TAG: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
+        run: |
+          docker build \
+            --build-arg VITE_API_URL=${{ secrets.VITE_API_URL }} \
+            --build-arg VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL=${{ secrets.VITE_MESSAGE_API_URL }} \
+            -t $ECR_REGISTRY/$ECR_REPOSITORY:$IMAGE_TAG \
+            .
+
+      - name: Push Docker image to ECR
+        env:
+          ECR_REGISTRY: ${{ steps.login-ecr.outputs.registry }}
+          IMAGE_TAG: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
+        run: |
+          docker push $ECR_REGISTRY/$ECR_REPOSITORY:$IMAGE_TAG
+
+      - name: Get Service ARN
+        id: service-arn

+            echo "Service not found: $APP_RUNNER_SERVICE"
+            exit 1
+          fi
+
+          echo "arn=$SERVICE_ARN" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
body:
_‚ö†Ô∏è Potential issue_ | _üü° Minor_

**Service ARN lookup may silently return "None" string.**

When the JMESPath query doesn't match, AWS CLI with `--output text` can return the literal string "None" rather than empty. The `-z` check won't catch this.

<details>
<summary>üõ†Ô∏è Proposed fix</summary>

```diff
          SERVICE_ARN=$(aws apprunner list-services \
            --region ${{ env.AWS_REGION }} \
            --query "ServiceSummaryList[?ServiceName=='$APP_RUNNER_SERVICE'].ServiceArn" \
            --output text)

-         if [ -z "$SERVICE_ARN" ]; then
+         if [ -z "$SERVICE_ARN" ] || [ "$SERVICE_ARN" = "None" ]; then
            echo "Service not found: $APP_RUNNER_SERVICE"
            exit 1
          fi
```
</details>

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In @.github/workflows/sitemap.yml around lines 71 - 81, The SERVICE_ARN lookup
can return the literal string "None" when the JMESPath query misses, so the
current -z check misses that case; update the validation after SERVICE_ARN is
assigned to treat both empty and "None" (case-insensitive) as not found and exit
with the same error path ‚Äî e.g., check SERVICE_ARN for being empty or equal to
"None" (or "none") before writing to GITHUB_OUTPUT; reference SERVICE_ARN,
APP_RUNNER_SERVICE and GITHUB_OUTPUT when making this change.
```

</details>

+
+async function fetchFromApi(endpoint, timeoutMs = 30000) {
+  const controller = new AbortController()
+  const timeoutId = setTimeout(() => controller.abort(), timeoutMs)
+
+  try {
+    const response = await fetch(`${API_URL}${endpoint}`, {
+      signal: controller.signal,
+    })
+    if (!response.ok) {
+      throw new Error(`API request failed: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`)
+    }
+    return response.json()
+  } finally {
+    clearTimeout(timeoutId)
+  }
+}
+
+async function fetchData() {
+  console.log(`Fetching data from API: ${API_URL}`)

+  ])
+
+  // Fetch each theme to get its miniatures
+  const themesWithMiniatures = await Promise.all(
+    themes.map((theme) => fetchFromApi(`/miniatures/themes/${theme.id}`))
+  )

**Consider batching theme requests for scalability.**

The script currently fetches 3 themes via `Promise.all`, which is fine at the current scale. However, if theme count grows, simultaneous requests to the API could become problematic. Consider implementing batching (e.g., fetching N themes at a time) or adding retry logic via `Promise.allSettled` for robustness when scaling. This is a build-time script, so it's not performance-critical for the public site, but it's good defensive programming.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In `@scripts/generate-sitemap.js` around lines 43 - 45, The current call using
Promise.all over themes (themesWithMiniatures = await
Promise.all(themes.map((theme) =>
fetchFromApi(`/miniatures/themes/${theme.id}`)))) can overload the API when
theme count grows; change this to a batched fetch approach (e.g., implement a
helper like fetchInBatches or fetchThemesInBatches that takes a batchSize N and
iterates over themes, issuing fetchFromApi calls in groups) or replace with a
resilient pattern using Promise.allSettled plus simple retry logic around
fetchFromApi for failed items; update the code that references
themesWithMiniatures to use the new helper and make batchSize configurable for
future tuning.
```

+import { useHead } from '@unhead/vue'
+import { computed, unref } from 'vue'
+
+const BASE_URL = 'https://gunarsk.com'
+const SITE_NAME = 'GunƒÅrs Kunakovs'
+const DEFAULT_DESCRIPTION =
+  'Full-stack developer specializing in Go, Vue.js, and cloud technologies.'
+const DEFAULT_IMAGE = `${BASE_URL}/og-image.png`
+
+/**
+ * Composable for managing page SEO meta tags
+ * @param {Object} options - SEO options (can be refs or plain values)
+ * @param {string|Ref<string>} options.title - Page title
+ * @param {string|Ref<string>} options.description - Page description
+ * @param {string|Ref<string>} [options.image] - OG image URL
+ * @param {string|Ref<string>} [options.path] - Current path for canonical URL
+ * @param {string} [options.type='website'] - OG type
+ */
+export function useSeoMeta({ title, description, image, path, type = 'website' }) {
+  useHead({
+    title: computed(() => {
+      const t = unref(title)
+      return t ? `${t} | ${SITE_NAME}` : `${SITE_NAME} - Full-Stack Developer`
+    }),
+    meta: computed(() => {
+      const t = unref(title) || SITE_NAME
+      const d = unref(description) || DEFAULT_DESCRIPTION
+      const img = unref(image) || DEFAULT_IMAGE
+      const p = unref(path)
+      const canonical = p ? `${BASE_URL}${p}` : BASE_URL
+      const absoluteImg = img.startsWith('http') ? img : `${BASE_URL}${img}`
+
+      return [
+        { name: 'description', content: d },
+        // Open Graph
+        { property: 'og:title', content: t },
+        { property: 'og:description', content: d },
+        { property: 'og:image', content: absoluteImg },
+        { property: 'og:url', content: canonical },
+        { property: 'og:type', content: type },
+        { property: 'og:site_name', content: SITE_NAME },
+        { property: 'og:locale', content: 'en_US' },
+        // Twitter Card
+        { name: 'twitter:card', content: 'summary_large_image' },
+        { name: 'twitter:title', content: t },
+        { name: 'twitter:description', content: d },
+        { name: 'twitter:image', content: absoluteImg },
+      ]

+import { useHead } from '@unhead/vue'
+import { computed, unref } from 'vue'
+
+const BASE_URL = 'https://gunarsk.com'
+const SITE_NAME = 'GunƒÅrs Kunakovs'
+const DEFAULT_DESCRIPTION =
+  'Full-stack developer specializing in Go, Vue.js, and cloud technologies.'
+const DEFAULT_IMAGE = `${BASE_URL}/og-image.png`
+
+/**
+ * Composable for managing page SEO meta tags
+ * @param {Object} options - SEO options (can be refs or plain values)
+ * @param {string|Ref<string>} options.title - Page title
+ * @param {string|Ref<string>} options.description - Page description
+ * @param {string|Ref<string>} [options.image] - OG image URL

+ * @param {string} [options.type='website'] - OG type

+export function useSeoMeta({ title, description, image, path, type = 'website' }) {

```javascript
    // ... existing code using `canonical`
  }),
  link: computed(() => {
    const p = unref(path)
    const canonical = p ? `${BASE_URL}${p}` : BASE_URL
    return p ? [{ rel: 'canonical', href: canonical }] : []
  }),
})
```
